info.author: Don Morehouse
info.description:
===============================
Sopiva
===============================

.. image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/sopiva.svg
        :target: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sopiva

.. image:: https://img.shields.io/travis/dm-wyncode/sopiva.svg
        :target: https://travis-ci.org/dm-wyncode/sopiva

.. image:: https://readthedocs.org/projects/sopiva/badge/?version=latest
        :target: https://readthedocs.org/projects/sopiva/?badge=latest
        :alt: Documentation Status


Sopiva is a python-requests_ based tool for gathering meta data on websites with a concentration on finding data sites amenable to adapting to a RESTful API as discussed in this Code-for-Miami GitHub issue_.

* Free software: MIT license
* Documentation: https://sopiva.readthedocs.org.

Inspiration
-----------

* examination of `existing data in Miami-Dade county`_.
* Question arose: Is there an automated way of gathering data on all the URI's listed for a particular city in the `US City Open Data Census`_?

Features
--------

* TODO

Credits
---------

This package was created with Cookiecutter_ and the `audreyr/cookiecutter-pypackage`_ project template.

.. _Cookiecutter: https://github.com/audreyr/cookiecutter
.. _`audreyr/cookiecutter-pypackage`: https://github.com/audreyr/cookiecutter-pypackage
.. _python-requests: http://docs.python-requests.org/
.. _issue: https://github.com/Code-for-Miami/tasks/issues/41#issuecomment-201862383
.. _existing data in Miami-Dade county: http://us-city.census.okfn.org/place/miami
.. _US City Open Data Census: http://us-city.census.okfn.org/


=======
History
=======

0.1.0 (2016-03-28)
------------------

* First release on PyPI.
